Articles.Content: Did I miss the announcement on the forums for 1.0.4 release? I just spent my evening setting up my development environment for 1.0.3 and finishing updating and releasing one my mods specifically for that version. I'm almost sure that my release will work with 1.0.4 since its a very minor update, but I still have to download that version, install my mod and verify it works now. I've been on the forums much of the afternoon and evening, so shouldn't it have been obvious at some point that a new version had been released? It's just slightly irritating that I could have been developing and compiling my mod for 1.0.4 this entire time.
1.0.4. was announced on the daily kerbal, and it was to fix a bug with loading old craft files to 1.0.3. It was released in less than 24 hours after 1.0.3.

Ugh... my eyes must have overlooked that post. I'm used to seeing version announcements in the latest articles area on the side, something they have done with every release for a while until now IIRC.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T02:44:42Z" title="06/24/2015 02:44  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by stevehead**
Eh, np. Just make sure to check all the sources next time. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
